channel.title: Golang on Suraj Deshmukh
channel.description: Recent content in Golang on Suraj Deshmukh

item.title: Methods that satisfy interfaces in golang
item.description: Pointer receiver For a struct User with a method Work with pointer receiver. type User struct { Name string Period int } func (u *User) Work() { fmt.Println(u.Name, "has worked for", u.Period, "hrs.") } func main() { uval := User{"UserVal", 5} uval.Work() pval := &User{"UserPtr", 6} pval.Work() } See on go playground. output: UserVal has worked for 5 hrs. UserPtr has worked for 6 hrs. If we call this method on value type object uval it works, and obviously it works with pointer type object pval.
